subject: Re: [junit] nightly build feature
msgSnippet: ... Didn t notice the price difference. Was thinking of the combo, book + PDF, that you can get there. Sorry I failed to mention that. I really like having
messageBody:
On Jul 9, 2006, at 10:17 PM, Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

> On 7/9/06, Craig Demyanovich <demmer12@...> wrote:
> >
> > On Jul 7, 2006, at 7:11 PM, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> >
> > > didoss@... wrote:
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > Write tests and code,...write an Ant script to run all the
> > > > tests,...schedule the ant script to run nightly.
> > >
> > > If I had to start a Java project with /just one book/, I'd
> choose this
> > > one: http://tinyurl.com/jp643
> > >
> > > And no, I didn't write it.
> > Joe's recommendation is a good one; the book is fantastic! However,
> > I'd go the source to get it:
> >
> > http://pragmaticprogrammer.com/starter_kit/auto/index.html
>
> Mmmh... $33 "at the source", $19 at Amazon...
Didn't notice the price difference. Was thinking of the combo, book +
PDF, that you can get there. Sorry I failed to mention that. I really
like having both most of the time. I can read the paper edition when
I'm at home with my bookcase next to my desk, and I can keep going
with the PDF when I'm on the road. Granted, this book is not that
large, but some of their others are. And if you want to take more
than one on the road, you can't beat the portability of the PDF
editions!

Regards,
Craig
